required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Low-glycemic Index Meals Intake on DM2 Women Under Metformin Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Low-glycemic Index Lunches and Dinners Intake on Indicators of Satiety, Metabolic Parameters and Liver Steatosis Degree on Women With Type 2 Diabetes Under Metformin Therapy: Controlled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the effect of low-glycemic index versus control lunches and dinners intake on indicators of satiety, metabolic parameters and liver steatosis degree on women with type 2 diabetes under metformin therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Fasting glycemia at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Fasting glycemia (mg/dL) was measured at Baseline and at 12 weeks
Postprandial glycemia (mg/dL) was measured for lunch and dinner of one day at 4, 8 and 12 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Glycosylated hemoglobin at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Glycosylated hemoglobin was measured at Baseline and at 12 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Triglycerides at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Triglycerides (mg/dL) was measured at Baseline and at 12 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Total cholesterol/HDL ratio at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Total cholesterol/HDL ratio was measured at Baseline and at 12 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline HDL cholesterol at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: HDL cholesterol (mg/dL) was measured at Baseline and at 12 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Total cholesterol at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Total cholesterol (mg/dL) was measured at Baseline and at 12 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline LDL cholesterol at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: LDL cholesterol (mg/dL) was measured at Baseline and at 12 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline High-sensitivity C-reactive protein (hs-CRP) at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: High-sensitivity C-reactive protein (mg/L) was measured at Baseline and at 12 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Aspartate aminotransferase (AST) at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Aspartate aminotransferase (UI/L) was measured at Baseline and at 12 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Alanine aminotransferase (UI/L) was measured at Baseline and at 12 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Liver steatosis degree at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Liver steatosis degree was measured at Baseline, 4, 8 and 12 weeks
Visual Analog Scale (VAS) was applied after lunches and dinners of 7 days to each subject
24-hour recall was applied the same 7 days as the VAS to each subject

secondary_outcome.description: Body mass index (BMI) (kg/m2) was measured at Baseline, 4, 8 and 12 weeks.
Waist circumference (cm) was measured at Baseline, 4, 8 and 12 weeks.
Alcohol intake (g/day) was measured at Baseline, 4, 8 and 12 weeks.
Physical activity was measured at Baseline, 4, 8 and 12 weeks.

The percentage of adherence to treatment was measured through a daily survey for 12 weeks. It is the calculation of compliance with planned meals intake (number of lunches and dinners eaten / total number of lunches and dinners of the study x 100).

arm_group.description: Medium/high glycemic index lunches and dinners (>60%)

intervention.description: Subjects ate low-glycemic index lunches and dinners (<55%),consisting of salad, main course and dessert, respectively.
Subjects ate standard lunches and dinners (>60%),consisting of salad, main course and dessert, respectively.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjets with type 2 diabetes mellitus diagnosis under metformin therapy.
- Female sex.
- Aged 30 to 65 years.
- Body Mass Index (BMI) 22 to 34.9 kg / m2.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women with insulin-releasing drugs or insulin treatment.
- Patients with diabetic nephropathy, retinopathy, chronic kidney disease, stroke.
- Subjects with hypothyroidism without treatment.
- Individuals with food allergies or intolerances.
- Women who present an intake of â‰¥20 g of alcohol per day quantified through a closed consumption frequency survey.
- Patients with previously diagnosed hepatitis, hepatic cirrhosis or liver cancer.
